labels.analysis: The MCP Server is specifically designed to optimize performance and reduce token consumption in language model interactions by caching frequently accessed data. It provides tools to store, retrieve, and manage cached data, including setting Time-to-Live (TTL) for entries and clearing the cache as needed. Its primary purpose is to improve efficiency and speed in data retrieval for language models.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Memory Management" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around storing, retrieving, and managing cached data, which aligns closely with memory and data optimization. No secondary labels were deemed necessary as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality. No custom label is needed as the existing labels sufficiently describe the server's purpose.

tools.name: store_data
tools.description: Store data in the cache with optional TTL

key.description: Unique identifier for the cached data
Key of the cached data to retrieve

tools.name: clear_cache
tools.description: Clear specific or all cache entries

key.description: Specific key to clear (optional - clears all if not provided)

server_info_crawled.name: Memory Cache Server
server_info_crawled.author: @ibproduct/ib-mcp-cache-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Reduce token consumption by efficiently caching data between language model interactions. Automatically store and retrieve frequently accessed data to enhance performance without any extra effort from you. Experience faster responses and optimized resource usage with seamless caching integration.

tools.name: store_data
tools.description: Store data in the cache with optional TTL

key.description: Unique identifier for the cached data
Key of the cached data to retrieve

tools.name: clear_cache
tools.description: Clear specific or all cache entries

key.description: Specific key to clear (optional - clears all if not provided)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "maxMemory": 104857600,
  "defaultTTL": 3600,
  "maxEntries": 1000,
  "checkInterval": 60000,
  "statsInterval": 30000
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@ibproduct/ib-mcp-cache-server/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
